name: Galaxy S21 Ultra
description: The Samsung Galaxy S21 Ultra is the headliner of the S21 series. It's the first S series phone to support Samsung's S Pen. Specifications are top-notch including Snapdragon 888 chipset, 5G capability, up to 16gigs of RAM, and 512GB of storage. A 5000mAh battery keeps the lights on for this powerhouse. In the camera department, a quad-camera setup is presented with two telephoto sensors. The Samsung Galaxy S21 Ultra starting price is $1200.

name: Galaxy Z Fold3
description: The Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 3 is the company's most ambitious, productivity-centric smartphone yet. This phone is a little bit slimmer than its predecessor when unfolded and the overall weight is a bit lower at 271g (vs 282g), but it's still just as chunky in its folded state. The outer display or â€˜cover screen' on the Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 3 is more or less the same as it was on the Galaxy Z Fold 2, except that it now supports an adaptive 120Hz refresh rate. The main attraction is of course the folding 7.6-inch AMOLED display which has a higher resolution of 2,208x1,768, along with HDR10 playback and a 120Hz refresh rate

name: Galaxy Z Flip3
description: Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 3 mobile was launched on 11th August 2021. The phone comes with a 6.70-inch touchscreen primary display with a resolution of 1080x2640 pixels at a pixel density of 425 pixels per inch (ppi). It also features a 1.90-inch touchscreen as its second display, with a resolution of 260x512 pixels. Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 3 is powered by an octa-core processor. It comes with 8GB of RAM. The Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 3 runs Android 11 and is powered by a 3300mAh battery. The Samsung Galaxy Z Flip 3 supports wireless charging.
